title: METAL CLASSIC: Sepultura Schizophrenia
description:
Second in a series

Sepultura is a great death/thrash band from Brazil. Being the first metal band (confirmation please, I think it was them or Sarcofago) from Brazil to gain international recognition you know they gotta be kickass. They first started as described above, a death/thrash band, but since \"Chaos A.D.\" they started playing groove metal with tribal influences. Since Max\&#039;s departure, Sepultura has failed to attain success with singer/guitarist Derrick Green, not that it\&#039;s his fault. Now it seems Igor (or Iggor as he prefers it) has left the band to form Cavalera Conspiracy with his brother.

Anyway, Sepultura returns with their second LP \"Schizophrenia\". This album was the first to feature Andreas Kisser, who was originally Max\&#039;s roadie, on guitars. From that first riff in \"From the Past Comes the Storms\" you know this album pretty much owns your soul. The album never let you rest until the pretty much unnecessary instrumental \"The Abyss\". \"Inquisition Symphony\" is instrumental thrash at its best at 7 minutes(!) and the rest of the album is pretty much a precursor to their next album, the legendary and absolutely classic \"Beneath the Remains\".

This rip is 320 kbps and, as with the Anthrax one, got from the CD. In this case the 1997 remasters with \"Troops of Doom\", \"The Past Reborns the Storms\" and some rough mixes for \"Septic Schizo\" and \"To The Wall\".

BUY THIS ALBUM IF YOU LIKE IT OR IT WILL REBORNS YOU!!!!!
